content.body: Hopefully mrego can help with the ARIA mess a bit
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: Hopefully mrego can help with the ARIA mess a bit

content.body: so if I'm understanding correctly the problem is with this section https://html.spec.whatwg.org/#accessibility-semantics
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: so if I'm understanding correctly the problem is with this section https://html.spec.whatwg.org/#accessibility-semantics

content.body: rego: yeah, it's not clear how element references work for that
content.formatted_body: rego: yeah, it's not clear how element references work for that

org.matrix.msc1767.message.body: rego: yeah, it's not clear how element references work for that

content.body: But also, it's not immediately clear how the ARIA specification uses the reflect infrastructure to expose the element references to AT
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: But also, it's not immediately clear how the ARIA specification uses the reflect infrastructure to expose the element references to AT

content.body: Thus far I think ARIA relied on attribute -> AT property mapping of some sort, but that wouldn't work here
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: Thus far I think ARIA relied on attribute -> AT property mapping of some sort, but that wouldn't work here

content.body: I guess there's also a slight problem that things like https://w3c.github.io/aria/#aria-activedescendant don't acknowledge the empty string as a possible value when set through script
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: I guess there's also a slight problem that things like https://w3c.github.io/aria/#aria-activedescendant don't acknowledge the empty string as a possible value when set through script

content.body: rego: I'm happy to help with fixing some of this btw, trying to understand the scope of the problem first and what kind of solution might be required to support both Element and ElementInternals classes
content.formatted_body: rego: I'm happy to help with fixing some of this btw, trying to understand the scope of the problem first and what kind of solution might be required to support both Element and ElementInternals classes

content.body: mmm, I see a bunch of things then... I don't really know how ARIA connects the attributes with AT
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: mmm, I see a bunch of things then... I don't really know how ARIA connects the attributes with AT

content.body: but yeah, with element reflection, the attribute is no longer the source of true
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: but yeah, with element reflection, the attribute is no longer the source of true

content.body: so there can be a bunch of things that need to get updated

content.body:
> <@annevk:matrix.org> I guess there's also a slight problem that things like https://w3c.github.io/aria/#aria-activedescendant don't acknowledge the empty string as a possible value when set through script

I guess a similar issue happens with `aria-describedby` and the ones pointing to a list of ids, not sure if using an empty string for them is also defined
content.formatted_body:
In reply to @annevk:matrix.org
I guess there's also a slight problem that things like https://w3c.github.io/aria/#aria-activedescendant don't acknowledge the empty string as a possible value when set through script
I guess a similar issue happens with aria-describedby and the ones pointing to a list of ids, not sure if using an empty string for them is also defined

content.body: it looks like relationships with AT are defined in other specs like accname or core-amm, and not in ARIA itself
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: it looks like relationships with AT are defined in other specs like accname or core-amm, and not in ARIA itself

content.body: for example this PR is trying to fix this issue in accname: https://github.com/w3c/accname/pull/170
